title: RMP Next Function Block
description:
_RMP_NEXT follows at the output OUT to the input signal IN with the in TR
and TF defned rising or falling fanks. Unlike RMP_SOFT the fank of
RMP_NEXT runs until it underrun or overrun the endpoint and is therefore
suitable for control tasks. Changing the value of IN so a rising ramp with
TR or a falling fank with TF starts at the output OUT until the value of OUT
has overrun or underrun the IN. The output then remains at this value. The
outputs of UP and DN shows just whether a rising or a falling edge are
created. The output DIR indicates the direction of change at IN, if IN is not
changed, the output remains at the last state. The lock time TL determiï¿¾nes the delay time between the direction reversal.

name: _RMP_NEXT

input.name: E
input.description: Enable/disable input, with initial value set to TRUE.

input.name: IN
input.description: Current input value for the ramp control.

input.name: TR
input.description: Time duration for ramping state when moving upwards.

input.name: TF
input.description: Time duration for ramping state when moving downwards.

input.name: TL
input.description: Lock time duration for the ramp.

output.name: DIR
output.description: Indicates the direction of ramping; upwards if TRUE.

output.name: UP
output.description: Output indicating if the ramp is moving upwards.

output.name: DN
output.description: Output indicating if the ramp is moving downwards.

in/out.name: OUT
in/out.description: Current output value that can be modified by the function block.
